name: Smiling Jack

topics.topic_text: I need you to repair my stuff.
topics.response_text: Sure, thing. Just be quick about it before someone sees.

topics.topic_text: What do you have for sale?
topics.response_text: Fresh out of the hands of some mark. Take a look!
Shh. Not too loud. I don't really want people to know that we're doin' business.
Like I told ya man, I don't fuckin' know where it came from. But it freaks the boys out. Some story from a while back, 'bout a stranger with no name.
We're back.  Somebody open up the... Hang on, something' ain't right here.{Raider captain over intercom, returning from a raid. NOTE: add radio/intercom filter.}

conversation.response_text: Just say the word and it's all over. Course then we'd have to skin you alive and eat your liver.

combat.response_text: I'm gonna mount you on my fucking wall!{angry, screaming}

description:
Smiling Jack is a 45 year-old Caucasian Male.

A non-hostile raider merchant who runs his general shop in the Evergreen Mills bazaar in the Capital Wasteland. Despite his affiliation with raiders, he maintains a neutral stance towards outsiders and focuses on his trading business.

Smiling Jack's Personality: Pragmatic and business-minded, Smiling Jack is primarily concerned with his trading operations and personal projects. He maintains a cautious neutrality, avoiding direct conflict unless provoked. His nickname comes from his tendency to remain pleasant during negotiations, even when dealing with difficult customers.

Smiling Jack's Backstory: Before becoming a merchant in Evergreen Mills, Smiling Jack was a wandering scavenger and trader in the Capital Wasteland. Recognizing the opportunity in raider-controlled territory, he established himself as a valuable resource by offering repair services and trading goods that raiders couldn't easily obtain elsewhere. His skill in bartering and equipment modification earned him a unique position of tolerance within the raider hierarchy, allowing him to operate his shop without participating in their violent activities. He spends his free time working on his personal project: modifying a unique shotgun he calls 'The Terrible Shotgun'.
